description:
Software installed and run as a non-privileged user may conduct improper GPU system calls to issue reads and writes to arbitrary physical memory pages.

Under certain circumstances this exploit could be used to corrupt data pages not allocated by the GPU driver but memory pages in use by the kernel and drivers running on the platform, altering their behaviour.
summary: This vulnerability allows software being used by a regular user to improperly access and manipulate the memory of the computer's GPU, potentially causing data corruption and altering the behavior of the system. It affects any system running software with GPU access privileges. To mitigate this risk, users should install security updates provided by the software vendor to patch the vulnerability.

description: Software installed and run as a non-privileged user may conduct improper GPU system calls to corrupt kernel heap memory.
summary: This vulnerability allows software running as a regular user to exploit the GPU system calls in a way that can corrupt the kernel heap memory. This could potentially lead to a system crash or other malicious activities. Users of systems with GPUs should make sure to apply any patches or updates provided by their software vendors to mitigate this risk.

description:
SIMPLE.ERP client is vulnerable to MS SQL protocol downgrade request from a server side, what could lead to an unencrypted communication vulnerable to data interception and modification.

This issue affect SIMPLE.ERP from 6.20 to 6.30. Only the 6.30 version received a patch 6.30@a03.9, which make it possible for an administrator to enforce encrypted communication. Versions 6.20 and 6.25 remain unpatched.
summary: The vulnerability in SIMPLE.ERP allows for unencrypted communication, making data interception and modification possible. This affects versions 6.20 to 6.30, with only version 6.30 receiving a patch to enforce encrypted communication. Users of versions 6.20 and 6.25 should take action by updating to the patched version or implementing additional security measures to protect their data.

description:
The SIMPLE.ERP client stores superuser password in a recoverable format, allowing any authenticated SIMPLE.ERP user to escalate privileges to a database administrator.

This issue affect SIMPLE.ERP from 6.20 through 6.30. Only the 6.30 version received a patch 6.30@a03.9, which removed the vulnerability. Versions 6.20 and 6.25 remain unpatched.
summary: The vulnerability in SIMPLE.ERP allows any authenticated user to escalate their privileges to a database administrator by accessing the stored superuser password. This affects versions 6.20 and 6.25 of the software, as only version 6.30 has received a patch to fix the vulnerability. Users of affected versions should update to version 6.30@a03.9 to protect against this threat.

description: API Platform Core is a system to create hypermedia-driven REST and GraphQL APIs. Starting in version 3.3.8, a security check that gets called after GraphQl resolvers is always replaced by another one as there's no break in a clause. As this falls back to `security`, the impact is there only when there's only a security after resolver and none inside security. Version 3.3.15 contains a patch for the issue.
summary: A security vulnerability has been identified in API Platform Core version 3.3.8 and older, which could potentially allow attackers to bypass security checks in GraphQL APIs. This vulnerability may affect users who have implemented GraphQL resolvers without proper security measures. Users are advised to update to version 3.3.15 or newer to patch this issue.

description: A vulnerability classified as critical has been found in Digiwin ERP 5.1. Affected is the function DoUpload/DoWebUpload of the file /Api/FileUploadApi.ashx. The manipulation of the argument File leads to unrestricted upload. It is possible to launch the attack remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used. The vendor was contacted early about this disclosure but did not respond in any way.
summary: A critical vulnerability has been discovered in Digiwin ERP 5.1, which allows for unrestricted file uploads through the DoUpload/DoWebUpload function. This vulnerability can be exploited remotely and has been made public, increasing the risk of attacks. Users of Digiwin ERP should take immediate action to secure their systems, as the vendor has not responded to the disclosure.

description: HCL DevOps Deploy / HCL Launch could allow a remote privileged authenticated attacker to execute arbitrary commands on the system by sending specially crafted input containing special elements.
summary: A vulnerability has been found in HCL DevOps Deploy / HCL Launch that could allow a remote attacker with privileged access to execute arbitrary commands on the system by sending specially crafted input. This flaw could affect organizations using these software products for their DevOps processes. To mitigate this threat, it is recommended to update the software to the latest version or apply patches provided by the vendor.

description: Kyverno is a policy engine designed for cloud native platform engineering teams. Prior to version 1.14.0-alpha.1, Kyverno ignores subjectRegExp and IssuerRegExp while verifying artifact's sign with keyless mode. It allows the attacker to deploy kubernetes resources with the artifacts that were signed by unexpected certificate. Deploying these unauthorized kubernetes resources can lead to full compromise of kubernetes cluster. Version 1.14.0-alpha.1 contains a patch for the issue.
summary: A security vulnerability has been identified in the Kyverno policy engine prior to version 1.14.0-alpha.1. This vulnerability allows attackers to deploy unauthorized Kubernetes resources in a cluster, potentially leading to a full compromise. Users should update to version 1.14.0-alpha.1 or later to patch this issue and prevent unauthorized access to their Kubernetes clusters.

description: On 70mai Dash Cam 1S devices, by connecting directly to the dashcam's network and accessing the API on port 80 and RTSP on port 554, an attacker can bypass the device authorization mechanism from the official mobile app that requires a user to physically press on the power button during a connection.
summary: The CVE on 70mai Dash Cam 1S devices allows attackers to bypass the device authorization mechanism by connecting to the dashcam's network and accessing certain ports. This could potentially affect users of these devices. To mitigate the risk, users should update the device firmware to the latest version and avoid connecting to untrusted networks.

description: kanidim-provision is a helper utility that uses kanidm's API to provision users, groups and oauth2 systems. Prior to version 1.2.0, a faulty function intrumentation in the (optional) kanidm patches provided by kandim-provision will cause the provisioned admin credentials to be leaked to the system log. This only impacts users which both use the provided patches and provision their `admin` or `idm_admin` account credentials this way. No other credentials are affected. Users should recompile kanidm with the newest patchset from tag `v1.2.0` or higher. As a workaround, the user can set the log level `KANIDM_LOG_LEVEL` to any level higher than `info`, for example `warn`.
summary: A vulnerability in kanidim-provision allows admin credentials to be leaked to the system log. This could affect users who use the provided patches and provision their `admin` or `idm_admin` account credentials this way. Users should update kanidm to version 1.2.0 or higher, or set the log level to a higher level as a temporary fix.

description: Vite, a provider of frontend development tooling, has a vulnerability in versions prior to 6.2.3, 6.1.2, 6.0.12, 5.4.15, and 4.5.10. `@fs` denies access to files outside of Vite serving allow list. Adding `?raw??` or `?import&raw??` to the URL bypasses this limitation and returns the file content if it exists. This bypass exists because trailing separators such as `?` are removed in several places, but are not accounted for in query string regexes. The contents of arbitrary files can be returned to the browser. Only apps explicitly exposing the Vite dev server to the network (using `--host` or `server.host` config option) are affected. Versions 6.2.3, 6.1.2, 6.0.12, 5.4.15, and 4.5.10 fix the issue.
summary: The vulnerability in Vite versions prior to 6.2.3, 6.1.2, 6.0.12, 5.4.15, and 4.5.10 allows for unauthorized access to files outside of the Vite serving allow list by adding specific query strings to the URL. This can result in the contents of arbitrary files being displayed in the browser. Only apps that expose the Vite dev server to the network are affected. Users should update to versions 6.2.3, 6.1.2, 6.0.12, 5.4.15, or 4.5.10 to address this vulnerability.

description:
Spring Security 6.4.0 - 6.4.3 may not correctly locate method security annotations on parameterized types or methods. This may cause an authorization bypass. 

You are not affected if you are not using @EnableMethodSecurity, or
you do not have method security annotations on parameterized types or methods, or all method security annotations are attached to target methods
summary: The vulnerability in Spring Security versions 6.4.0 - 6.4.3 could allow an attacker to bypass authorization if method security annotations are not located correctly on certain types of methods. Users who do not use @EnableMethodSecurity or do not have specific method security annotations are not affected. It is recommended to ensure that all method security annotations are correctly applied to target methods to mitigate the risk of an authorization bypass.

description: A vulnerability classified as critical was found in Digiwin ERP 5.0.1. Affected by this vulnerability is an unknown functionality of the file /Api/TinyMce/UploadAjaxAPI.ashx. The manipulation of the argument File leads to unrestricted upload. The attack can be launched remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used. The vendor was contacted early about this disclosure but did not respond in any way.
summary: The vulnerability in Digiwin ERP 5.0.1 allows for unrestricted remote file upload, which can be exploited by attackers. Anyone using this software is potentially at risk. To protect against this threat, users should apply any patches or updates provided by the vendor, or consider discontinuing use of the affected software. Additionally, caution should be exercised when opening files or links from unknown or suspicious sources.

description: A vulnerability, which was classified as critical, has been found in zhijiantianya ruoyi-vue-pro 2.4.1. Affected by this issue is some unknown functionality of the file /app-api/infra/file/upload of the component Front-End Store Interface. The manipulation of the argument path leads to path traversal. The attack may be launched remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used. The vendor was contacted early about this disclosure but did not respond in any way.
summary: This critical vulnerability in the zhijiantianya ruoyi-vue-pro 2.4.1 software allows remote attackers to perform a path traversal attack through the /app-api/infra/file/upload file of the Front-End Store Interface component. This could potentially affect any users of this software. description: An authentication bypass vulnerability in Kentico Xperience allows authentication bypass via the Staging Sync Server password handling of empty SHA1 usernames in digest authentication. Authentication bypass allows an attacker to control administrative objects.This issue affects Xperience through 13.0.172.
summary: A security flaw in Kentico Xperience allows attackers to bypass authentication and gain control of administrative objects. This vulnerability affects versions of Xperience up to 13.0.172. To protect against this threat, users should update to the latest version of Kentico Xperience and regularly monitor for security updates.

description: An authentication bypass vulnerability in Kentico Xperience allows authentication bypass via the Staging Sync Server component password handling for the server defined None type. Authentication bypass allows an attacker to control administrative objects.This issue affects Xperience through 13.0.178.
summary: The CVE is a vulnerability in Kentico Xperience that allows an attacker to bypass authentication and gain control over administrative objects by exploiting the Staging Sync Server component password handling. This vulnerability impacts Xperience versions up to 13.0.178. To protect against this threat, users should update their Xperience software to the latest version available.

description: The Kentico Xperience application does not fully validate or filter files uploaded via the multiple-file upload functionality, which allows for stored XSS.This issue affects Kentico Xperience through 13.0.178.
summary: This vulnerability in Kentico Xperience allows hackers to upload malicious files that can exploit the application and perform a stored cross-site scripting attack. Users of Kentico Xperience up to version 13.0.178 are affected. To protect against this threat, users should update to the latest version of Kentico Xperience and avoid uploading any suspicious files.

description: An authenticated remote code execution in Kentico Xperience allows authenticated users Staging Sync Server to upload arbitrary data to path relative locations. This results in path traversal and arbitrary file upload, including content that can be executed server side leading to remote code execution.This issue affects Kentico Xperience through 13.0.178.
summary: This vulnerability in Kentico Xperience allows authenticated users to upload malicious files to the server, potentially leading to remote code execution. Users of Kentico Xperience up to version 13.0.178 are affected. To mitigate this threat, it is recommended to update Kentico Xperience to the latest version and monitor for any unauthorized file uploads.

description: Cilium is a networking, observability, and security solution with an eBPF-based dataplane. For Cilium users who use Gateway API for Ingress for some services and use LB-IPAM or BGP for LB Service implementation and use network policies to block egress traffic from workloads in a namespace to workloads in other namespaces, egress traffic from workloads covered by such network policies to LoadBalancers configured by `Gateway` resources will incorrectly be allowed. LoadBalancer resources not deployed via a Gateway API configuration are not affected by this issue. This issue affects: Cilium v1.15 between v1.15.0 and v1.15.14 inclusive, v1.16 between v1.16.0 and v1.16.7 inclusive, and v1.17 between v1.17.0 and v1.17.1 inclusive. This issue is fixed in Cilium v1.15.15, v1.16.8, and v1.17.2. A Clusterwide Cilium Network Policy can be used to work around this issue for users who are unable to upgrade.
summary: A vulnerability has been identified in Cilium, a networking, observability, and security solution. This issue affects users who utilize Gateway API for Ingress, LB-IPAM or BGP for LB Service implementation, and network policies to block egress traffic from workloads in one namespace to another. Egress traffic from workloads covered by these network policies to LoadBalancers configured by Gateway resources will be incorrectly allowed. Users of Cilium versions 1.15 to 1.17 are affected, with the issue being fixed in versions 1.15.15, 1.16.8, and 1.17.2. A Clusterwide Cilium Network Policy can be used as a workaround for those who are unable to upgrade. Users should update to the fixed versions or apply the workaround to mitigate the risk.

description: Cilium is a networking, observability, and security solution with an eBPF-based dataplane. Node based network policies (`fromNodes` and `toNodes`) will incorrectly permit traffic to/from non-node endpoints that share the labels specified in `fromNodes` and `toNodes` sections of network policies. Node based network policy is disabled by default in Cilium. This issue affects: Cilium v1.16 between v1.16.0 and v1.16.7 inclusive and v1.17 between v1.17.0 and v1.17.1 inclusive. This issue is fixed in Cilium v1.16.8 and v1.17.2. Users can work around this issue by ensuring that the labels used in `fromNodes` and `toNodes` fields are used exclusively by nodes and not by other endpoints.
summary: There is a vulnerability in Cilium, a networking, observability, and security solution, where node-based network policies may permit traffic to non-node endpoints that share the same labels. This affects Cilium versions v1.16.0 to v1.16.7 and v1.17.0 to v1.17.1. Users should upgrade to Cilium v1.16.8 or v1.17.2 to fix the issue. Until then, ensure that labels used in network policies are exclusive to nodes.

description:
PDF-XChange Editor RTF File Parsing Out-Of-Bounds Read Remote Code Execution Vulnerability. This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of PDF-XChange Editor. User interaction is required to exploit this vulnerability in that the target must visit a malicious page or open a malicious file.

The specific flaw exists within the parsing of RTF files. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of user-supplied data, which can result in a read past the end of an allocated buffer. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of the current process. Was ZDI-CAN-25473.
summary: This CVE is a vulnerability in the PDF-XChange Editor software that allows remote attackers to execute harmful code on a user's computer by tricking them into opening a malicious file or visiting a malicious website. The flaw occurs in the parsing of RTF files, potentially leading to an out-of-bounds read issue. Users of PDF-XChange Editor should update their software to the latest version to protect against this vulnerability.

summary: This vulnerability in the zhijiantianya ruoyi-vue-pro 2.4.1 component allows remote attackers to manipulate file paths and potentially access sensitive information on a system. description: Tenda AC8 V16.03.34.06 is vulnerable to Buffer Overflow in the fromSetRouteStatic function via the parameter list.
summary: A vulnerability has been found in the Tenda AC8 router (version 16.03.34.06) that allows attackers to execute a Buffer Overflow attack through the fromSetRouteStatic function by exploiting the parameter list. This vulnerability can potentially affect any users of this particular router model. To protect against this threat, users should update their router to the latest firmware version provided by the manufacturer.

description: A stack-based buffer overflow vulnerability in Tenda AC7 V15.03.06.44 allows a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code through a stack overflow attack using the security parameter of the formWifiBasicSet function.
summary: This CVE involves a security flaw in the Tenda AC7 V15.03.06.44 router that could be exploited by a hacker to run unauthorized code on the device. This vulnerability affects users of this specific router model. To protect against potential attacks, users should update the firmware of their Tenda AC7 router to a secure version.

description: An issue in onos v2.7.0 allows attackers to trigger a packet deserialization problem when supplying a crafted LLDP packet. This vulnerability allows attackers to execute arbitrary commands or access network information.
summary: This vulnerability in onos v2.7.0 allows attackers to send a specially crafted LLDP packet to trigger a problem with packet deserialization. This can lead to attackers being able to run unauthorized commands or access network information. Users of onos v2.7.0 are affected by this threat and should apply the latest security patches or updates to prevent exploitation of this vulnerability.

description: Limited secret space in LLDP packets used in onos v2.7.0 allows attackers to obtain the private key via a bruteforce attack. Attackers are able to leverage this vulnerability into creating crafted LLDP packets.
summary: In onos v2.7.0, there is a vulnerability that allows attackers to obtain the private key through a brute force attack by using limited secret space in LLDP packets. This can be used to create malicious LLDP packets. Users of onos v2.7.0 should take action to patch or update their systems to fix this vulnerability and prevent potential attacks.

description: An issue in onos v2.7.0 allows attackers to trigger unexpected behavior within a device connected to a legacy switch via changing the link type from indirect to direct.
summary: A vulnerability in onos v2.7.0 allows attackers to cause unexpected behavior in a device connected to a legacy switch by changing the link type. This issue poses a threat to users of onos v2.7.0. To mitigate this threat, users should update to the latest version of onos and ensure proper security measures are in place.

description: Use of incorrectly resolved name or reference in OpenDaylight Service Function Chaining (SFC) Subproject SFC Sodium-SR4 and below allows attackers to cause a Denial of Service (DoS).

This can affect users of OpenDaylight SFC, potentially disrupting their services. Users should update to a newer version of OpenDaylight to patch this vulnerability and protect against potential attacks.
software: OpenDaylight Service Function Chaining (SFC) Subproject SFC Sodium-SR4

summary: The CVE is about a security vulnerability in the OpenDaylight Service Function Chaining (SFC) subproject SFC Sodium-SR4 and below, which could allow attackers to access sensitive information through a man-in-the-middle attack. This threat affects users of this software version. To protect against this vulnerability, users should update to a secure version of the software and ensure proper cookie configurations in the Shiro security framework.
software: OpenDaylight Service Function Chaining (SFC) Subproject SFC Sodium-SR4

description: An issue in the Shiro-based RBAC (Role-based Access Control) mechanism of OpenDaylight Service Function Chaining (SFC) Subproject SFC Sodium-SR4 and below allows attackers to execute privileged operations via a crafted request.
summary: A vulnerability in the OpenDaylight Service Function Chaining software allows attackers to perform privileged operations by sending a specially crafted request. software: OpenDaylight Service Function Chaining (SFC) Subproject SFC Sodium-SR4

description:
SnapCenter versions prior to 
6.0.1P1 and 6.1P1 are susceptible to a vulnerability which may allow an 
authenticated SnapCenter Server user to become an admin user on a remote
 system where a SnapCenter plug-in has been installed.
summary: The vulnerability in SnapCenter allows an authenticated user to gain admin access on a remote system with a SnapCenter plug-in installed. This affects users of SnapCenter versions prior to 6.0.1P1 and 6.1P1. To protect against this threat, users should update to the latest version of SnapCenter.

The manipulation leads to path traversal. The attack can be initiated remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used. The vendor was contacted early about this disclosure but did not respond in any way.
summary: This CVE involves a security flaw in the China Mobile P22g-CIac 1.0.00.488 device, specifically in the Samba Path Handler component. This vulnerability could allow attackers to remotely manipulate paths and potentially access sensitive information. The exploit has been made public and could be used by malicious actors. description: A security issue was discovered in  ingress-nginx https://github.com/kubernetes/ingress-nginx  where the `auth-tls-match-cn` Ingress annotation can be used to inject configuration into nginx. This can lead to arbitrary code execution in the context of the ingress-nginx controller, and disclosure of Secrets accessible to the controller. (Note that in the default installation, the controller can access all Secrets cluster-wide.)
summary: The security issue found in ingress-nginx allows attackers to inject configuration into nginx using the `auth-tls-match-cn` Ingress annotation, which could result in arbitrary code execution and the disclosure of Secrets accessible to the controller. This affects users of the Kubernetes ingress-nginx controller. To mitigate this threat, users should update their ingress-nginx controller to the latest version.

description: A security issue was discovered in  ingress-nginx https://github.com/kubernetes/ingress-nginx  where the `mirror-target` and `mirror-host` Ingress annotations can be used to inject arbitrary configuration into nginx. This can lead to arbitrary code execution in the context of the ingress-nginx controller, and disclosure of Secrets accessible to the controller. (Note that in the default installation, the controller can access all Secrets cluster-wide.)
summary: This security issue in ingress-nginx allows hackers to inject unauthorized configuration into nginx, potentially leading to running malicious code and disclosing sensitive information in the context of the controller. Users of ingress-nginx are vulnerable to this threat, especially if the default installation settings are used. To mitigate the risk, it is recommended to update the ingress-nginx software to the latest version that addresses this vulnerability.

description: A security issue was discovered in Kubernetes where under certain conditions, an unauthenticated attacker with access to the pod network can achieve arbitrary code execution in the context of the ingress-nginx controller. This can lead to disclosure of Secrets accessible to the controller. (Note that in the default installation, the controller can access all Secrets cluster-wide.)
summary: This security vulnerability in Kubernetes allows attackers to execute code and potentially access sensitive information. It affects users who have not properly secured their Kubernetes installations. To protect against this threat, users should ensure that their Kubernetes configurations are properly secured, and consider restricting access to Secrets for the controller.

description: A security issue was discovered in  ingress-nginx https://github.com/kubernetes/ingress-nginx  where attacker-provided data are included in a filename by the ingress-nginx Admission Controller feature, resulting in directory traversal within the container. This could result in denial of service, or when combined with other vulnerabilities, limited disclosure of Secret objects from the cluster.
summary: The security issue in ingress-nginx allows attackers to access files in a container by manipulating filenames, potentially causing denial of service or exposing sensitive information. Users of ingress-nginx should update to the latest version to patch this vulnerability.

description: A security issue was discovered in  ingress-nginx https://github.com/kubernetes/ingress-nginx  where the `auth-url` Ingress annotation can be used to inject configuration into nginx. This can lead to arbitrary code execution in the context of the ingress-nginx controller, and disclosure of Secrets accessible to the controller. (Note that in the default installation, the controller can access all Secrets cluster-wide.)
summary: This security issue in the ingress-nginx software allows attackers to inject code into the controller, potentially leading to arbitrary code execution and disclosure of sensitive information like Secrets. This affects users of ingress-nginx and action should be taken to update the software to the latest version to patch this vulnerability and prevent potential attacks.

description: A vulnerability, which was classified as critical, has been found in D-Link DIR-823X 240126/240802. This issue affects the function sub_41710C of the file /goform/diag_nslookup of the component HTTP POST Request Handler. The manipulation of the argument target_addr leads to os command injection. The attack may be initiated remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used.
summary: The D-Link DIR-823X 240126/240802 device has a critical vulnerability that allows remote attackers to execute malicious commands on the system. Users of this device should be aware of the threat and update their firmware as soon as possible to protect against potential attacks.

description: A vulnerability was found in GNOME libgsf up to 1.14.53 and classified as problematic. Affected by this issue is the function gsf_base64_encode_simple. The manipulation of the argument size leads to use of uninitialized variable. The attack needs to be approached locally. The vendor was contacted early about this disclosure but did not respond in any way.
summary: This vulnerability in GNOME libgsf up to version 1.14.53 allows attackers to manipulate a function argument, leading to the use of uninitialized variables. This can be exploited locally. Users of GNOME libgsf should update to a fixed version. The vendor was notified but did not respond.

The manipulation of the argument size_t leads to heap-based buffer overflow. An attack has to be approached locally. description: A vulnerability was found in GNOME libgsf up to 1.14.53. It has been declared as critical. This vulnerability affects the function gsf_prop_settings_collect_va. The manipulation of the argument n_alloced_params leads to heap-based buffer overflow. Local access is required to approach this attack. The vendor was contacted early about this disclosure but did not respond in any way.
summary: This vulnerability in GNOME libgsf up to version 1.14.53 can be exploited by attackers with local access to cause a heap-based buffer overflow, leading to potential security issues. Users should update to the latest version of the software to protect against this threat. The vendor has not responded to the disclosure of this vulnerability.

description: A vulnerability was found in GNOME libgsf up to 1.14.53. It has been rated as critical. This issue affects the function gsf_property_settings_collec. The manipulation of the argument n_alloced_params leads to heap-based buffer overflow. Attacking locally is a requirement. summary: The CVE is a critical vulnerability found in GNOME libgsf up to version 1.14.53. The threat is a heap-based buffer overflow that can be exploited by manipulating a certain function. It only affects users who have local access to the system. The vendor has been notified but has not responded. Users should be cautious and monitor for any potential exploitation of this vulnerability.

description: A vulnerability classified as problematic has been found in GNOME libgsf up to 1.14.53. Affected is the function sorting_key_copy. The manipulation of the argument Name leads to out-of-bounds read. It is possible to launch the attack on the local host. The vendor was contacted early about this disclosure but did not respond in any way.

description: The WP Church Donation plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via several donation form submission parameters in all versions up to, and including, 1.7 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.

This affects all versions up to 1.7 of the plugin. Website administrators using this plugin should update to the latest version as soon as possible to protect against potential attacks.

description: The Estatebud – Properties & Listings plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Cross-Site Request Forgery in all versions up to, and including, 5.5.0. This is due to missing or incorrect nonce validation on the 'estatebud_settings' page. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to update the plugin's settings via a forged request granted they can trick a site administrator into performing an action such as clicking on a link.

This affects all versions up to 5.5.0. Site administrators should update the plugin to version 5.5.1 or later to fix this vulnerability and prevent exploitation by unauthenticated attackers.

description: The Alert Box Block – Display notice/alerts in the front end. plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the plugin's Alert Box block in all versions up to, and including, 1.1.2 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping on user supplied attributes. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with contributor-level access and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.
summary: The Alert Box Block plugin for WordPress is at risk of a Stored Cross-Site Scripting vulnerability, which allows authenticated attackers with contributor-level access or higher to inject harmful scripts into web pages. description: The EZ SQL Reports Shortcode Widget and DB Backup plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Cross-Site Request Forgery in versions 4.11.13 to 5.25.08. This is due to missing or incorrect nonce validation on the 'ELISQLREPORTS_menu' function. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to execute code on the server via a forged request granted they can trick a site administrator into performing an action such as clicking on a link. Version 5.25.10 adds a nonce check, which makes this vulnerability exploitable by admins only.
summary: The EZ SQL Reports Shortcode Widget and DB Backup plugin for WordPress is at risk of Cross-Site Request Forgery, allowing attackers to execute code on the server if they can trick a site administrator into performing an action. Users of versions 4.11.13 to 5.25.08 are affected. To mitigate this threat, users should update to version 5.25.10 which includes a nonce check, making the vulnerability exploitable only by admins.

description: The Frndzk Expandable Bottom Bar plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via 'text' parameter in all versions up to, and including, 1.0 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with administrator-level permissions and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page. This only affects multi-site installations and installations where unfiltered_html has been disabled.
summary: The Frndzk Expandable Bottom Bar plugin for WordPress is at risk of a Stored Cross-Site Scripting attack, which allows attackers with administrator-level permissions to inject harmful scripts into web pages that can be executed by users visiting those pages. This vulnerability affects multi-site installations and installations that have disabled unfiltered_html. Users should update to version 1.1 or newer to protect against this threat.

description: A flaw was found in Keycloak. When the configuration uses JWT tokens for authentication, the tokens are cached until expiration. If a client uses JWT tokens with an excessively long expiration time, for example, 24 or 48 hours, the cache can grow indefinitely, leading to an OutOfMemoryError. This issue could result in a denial of service condition, preventing legitimate users from accessing the system.
summary: The Keycloak security system has a vulnerability where if an attacker uses JWT tokens with a very long expiration time, it can cause the system to run out of memory and stop legitimate users from accessing it. Users of Keycloak should update their systems to address this issue and prevent potential denial of service attacks.

It is possible to launch the attack remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used.

This could potentially impact users of this specific component, the LWS File Handler. To protect against this threat, users should update to the latest version of the software or apply any relevant patches as soon as possible.

description: A vulnerability was found in Open Asset Import Library Assimp 5.4.3. It has been declared as critical. The manipulation of the argument it leads to heap-based buffer overflow. The attack can be launched remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used.

description:
Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an SQL Command ('SQL Injection') vulnerability in Apache VCL. Users can modify form data submitted when requesting a new Block Allocation such that a SELECT SQL statement is modified. The data returned by the SELECT statement is not viewable by the attacker.

This issue affects all versions of Apache VCL from 2.2 through 2.5.1.

Users are recommended to upgrade to version 2.5.2, which fixes the issue.
summary: The CVE involves a vulnerability in Apache VCL that allows users to manipulate form data to modify SQL commands, specifically a SELECT statement. This vulnerability affects all versions of Apache VCL from 2.2 through 2.5.1. Users are advised to update to version 2.5.2 to resolve this issue and prevent potential exploitation by attackers.

description:
Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting') vulnerability in Apache VCL in the User Lookup form. A user with sufficient rights to be able to view this part of the site can craft a URL or be tricked in to clicking a URL that will give a specified user elevated rights.



This issue affects all versions of Apache VCL through 2.5.1.



Users are recommended to upgrade to version 2.5.2, which fixes the issue.
summary: The Apache VCL software has a vulnerability that could allow a user to gain elevated rights by manipulating a URL. This affects all versions up to 2.5.1. To protect against this threat, users should upgrade to version 2.5.2, which resolves the issue.

description: The Your Simple SVG Support plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via SVG File uploads in all versions up to, and including, 1.0.1 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. software: Your Simple SVG Support plugin for WordPress

description: The WP Compress – Instant Performance & Speed Optimization plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Server-Side Request Forgery in all versions up to, and including, 6.30.15 via the init() function. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to make web requests to arbitrary locations originating from the web application and can be used to query information from internal services.
